author: Special Correspondent
text:
Students of a private Industrial Training Institute at V.M. Chathram in Palayamkottai submitted a petition to District Revenue Officer M.G. Kulandaivel on Monday seeking reimbursement of their tuition fee.

They said reimbursement of tuition fee for the ITI students, which had been in practice since July 2012 following a Government Order, had been stopped to them since 2015 without any prior intimation to leave the studies of a few hundred students in the lurch.

Hence, the tuition fee, usually being disbursed through the Department of Employment and Training, should be reimbursed to them, they prayed.

Another group of students from a private engineering college at Cheranmahadevi submitted a petition seeking the revival of a suspended bus service via their college.
title: ITI students seek reimbursement of tuition fee
